head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 2 distinct parts:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. The older portion of the manuscript, metrical homilies of Jacob of Batnae. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 29 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.title: The older portion of the manuscript, metrical homilies of Jacob of Batnae
On the Creation of the Universe.
On the Six Days.
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 339, no. 224 . It is divided into seven parts.

msItem.title: On Jonah
msItem.note: It is divided into probably not less than seven or eight parts.
The rest of the discourse being very imperfect, we cannot say how much farther the division was carried.
On fol. 60 b a more modern hand has marked a division by four large dots % and the word ܫܠܡ on the margin.

msItem.title: On the Antichrist.
msItem.note: See Assem., p. 314, no. 56, serm. iv.

msItem.title: On the Crucifixion of our Lord.
msItem.note: It is divided into six parts, of which the first (ܩܘܡܐ ܕܠܠܝܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܫܒܐ) is wanting, and the second is imperfect at the beginning.
There is another division by a more recent hand.

msItem.title: On the Chariot which Ezekiel saw
On our Lord, and Moses and Elias conversing with him in the cloud.
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܡܪܢ ܘܡܘܫܐ ܘܐܠܝܐ ܟܕ ܡܡܠܠܝܢ ܥܡܗ̣ ܒܥܢܢܐ

msItem.title: On the rich man and Lazarus.
In heptasyllabic metre
msItem.incipit: ܩܪܒܐ ܥܒ̇ܕ ܙܟܘܬܐ. ܘܕܪܐ ܗܘ ܥܠܬܗ ܕܟܠܝܠܐ. ܘܡܢ ܐܓܘܢܐ ܡܬܝܕܥܢܐ ܐܬܠܝܛܘܬܐ ܕܚ̈ܠܝܨܐ

msItem.title: In dodecasyllabic metre.
msItem.rubric: ܡܠܟܐ ܕܥܘܼܠܐ ܫܕܪ ܟܢܫ̣ ܚܝ̈ܠܘܬܗ. ܕܥܡ ܙܕܝܩܐ ܩܪܒܐ ܢ̇ܥܒܕ ܚܣܝܢܐܝܬ.

msItem.title: On the Deluge.
msItem.incipit: ܟܐܢܐ ܕܩܦܚ ܒܓܙܪ ܕܝܢ̣ܗ ܠܕܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܢܘܚ. ܦܬ̣ܚ ܠܗ̇ ܠܡܠܬܝ ܬܪ̈ܥܐ ܪ̈ܘܝܚܐ ܕܬܦܩ ܫܪ̈ܒܝܟ.

msItem.title: On Palm-Sunday.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܡ̈ܓܒܝܐ ܕܣܝܡܝܢ ܠܡܠܦܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܚܕ ܕܥܠ ܐܫܬܬ ܝܘ̈ܡܐ. ܏ܘܫ. ܕܗ̈ܘܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܒܡܢܝܢܐ ܥܣܪ̈ܐ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 230 leaves, some of which are much stained (e.g. foll. 186 and 187) and not a few more or less torn (e.g. foll. 10, 19, 36, 56, 57, 65—68, 126, 141, 171, 185—188). The quires, signed with letters, are 26 in number, but nearly the whole of ܛ and ܝ has been lost, and several of the others are imperfect. Leaves are wanting after foll. 26, 27, 57, 61, 64, 70, 72, 73, 184, and 185. Each page is divided into two columns, containing, in the older part of the manuscript, from 31 to 36 lines.

item.p: Vellum, about 10 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 230 leaves, some of which are much stained (e.g. foll. 186 and 187) and not a few more or less torn (e.g. foll. 10, 19, 36, 56, 57, 65—68, 126, 141, 171, 185—188). The quires, signed with letters, are 26 in number, but nearly the whole of ܛ and ܝ has been lost, and several of the others are imperfect. Leaves are wanting after foll. 26, 27, 57, 61, 64, 70, 72, 73, 184, and 185. Each page is divided into two columns, containing, in the older part of the manuscript, from 31 to 36 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The greater part of the volume, from fol. 2 b to fol. 216 a (with the exception of foll. 214 and 215), is written in a small, regular Estrangělā of the viith cent.
See additions. On fol. 60 b a more modern hand has marked a division by four large dots % and the word ܫܠܡ on the margin.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: A note on fol. 2 a, now much effaced, in a current hand of about the ixth cent., states that the volume was presented by certain persons unnamed to the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܝܠܢ. ܝܕܥ ܠܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܕܝܠܗܘܢ
ܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ. ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ. ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩ̈ܝܛܐ ܕܒܡܨܪܝܢ

item.p: Another note of not much later date, on fol. 1 a, records the fact of its belonging to the convent.

The manuscript must, however, have been purloined soon after, since we learn from a second note on fol. 1 a that it was restored by one Melchizedek, who had got it as a present from the monk Jacob of Samosata.

p.quote: ܐܬܚܦܛ ܘܩܢܐ ܣܝܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ ܡܠܟܝܙܕܩ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ. ܐܫܬܟܢ ܠܗ ܒܘܪܟܬܐ ܡܢ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܕܡܢ ܫܡܝܫܛ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܘܫܟܢܗ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ. ܐܠܐ ܟܠܗ (sic) ܕܦܓܥ ܒܗ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܕܢܚܘܢ ܐܢܘܢ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܢܚܣܐ ܚܘܒ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܐܡܝܢ ܐܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: Lastly, there is a note on fol. 216 a, seemingly of the same date as that immediately preceding, which states that the book belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܝܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩ̈ܝܛܐ. ܟܠ ܕܐܟܐܡ (sic) ܥܠ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܐܘ ܡܫܢܐ ܠܗ ܡܢ ܕܝܪܐ ܗܕܐ. ܐܘ ܠܚܐ ܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܡܚܪܡܐ ܢܗܘܐ. ܘܢܘܟܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܐܡܝܢ.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The more modern portion of the manuscript, discourses by several authors. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 8 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.author: Epiphanius
Helladius
msItem.title: The more modern portion of the manuscript, discourses by several authors.
Metrical homilies of Jacob of Batnae
On the Resurrection of the Dead, and the Woman who had seven husbands.
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܝܬ ܡ̈ܝܬܐ. ܘܥܠ ܗ̇ܝ ܐܢܬܬܐ ܕܫܒܥܐ ܓܒܪ̈ܝܗ

msItem.title: On the Dead.
msItem.note: See Assem., p. 313, no. 44, serm. ii .

msItem.title: Panegyric on the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܦܝܦܢܝܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܦܪܣ ܕܥܠ ܩܘܠܣܗ̇ ܕܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܡ݊ܪܝ݊ܡ݊
msItem.note: See Opera, ed. Petavius, t. ii., p. 291 .

msItem.title: An account of the miracles of Basil, bishop of Caesarea, by his successor Helladius
msItem.rubric: ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܒ̣ܝܕܐ ܠܚܣܝܐ ܗܠܕܝܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܣܪܝܐ ܩܦܕܘܩܝܐ. ܥܠ ܬܕܡܪ̈ܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܘܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗ̣ܘܐ ܪܝܫ ܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇ ܕܡܕܝܢܬܐ
msItem.note: Imperfect, and very much soiled and torn.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 230 leaves, some of which are much stained and not a few more or less torn (e.g. 227 —230). The quires, signed with letters, are 26 in number, but nearly the whole of ܛ and ܝ has been lost, and several of the others are imperfect. Each page is divided into two columns, containing from 31 to 44 lines.

item.p: Vellum, about 10 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 230 leaves, some of which are much stained and not a few more or less torn (e.g. 227 —230). The quires, signed with letters, are 26 in number, but nearly the the whole of ܛ and ܝ has been lost, and several of the others are imperfect. Each page is divided into two columns, containing from 31 to 44 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The latter part of the manuscript, viz. foll. 214, 215, and 216 a—230 b, is in a current hand of the ixth cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

CHANGED: deleted empty elements and attributes
CHANGED: Added project metadata; metadata from Wright Decoder; msItem, handDesc, and additions enumeration; Wright Taxonomy designation
